cause.description:
Philip Paarthipan Coomarasamy developed symptoms of Wegener's Granulomatosis within two weeks and died at the age of 22. The symptoms were aches and swelling in his joints that moved from one area to another, swelling of the lymphatic glands and difficulty breathing. This was a hard diagnosis to come by; my brother went to the ER twice and was seen by numerous doctors before he was admitted to the ICU with respiratory difficulties. Within 24 hrs he began to cough up blood as his lungs were haemorraging. He was admitted to the ICU on May 19, 2006 and he passed away on May 26, 2006.
http://philip-coomarasamy.memory-of.com/
What is Wegener’s Granulomatosis?
* It is characterized by an inflammation of the blood vessels and of tissues with can cause irreparable damage * Can involve any organ * It mainly affects the respiratory system and kidneys
Common warning signs of Wegener’s Granulomatosis?
* Upper respiratory tract symptoms are very common, including sinus pain, a runny nose and blocked ears ( hearing loss) * Lungs can be affected causing a cough with or without blood and shortness of breath * Muscle and joint pain and inflammation of joints resembling arthritis * Skin lesions
Note: Different people will develop varying sets of symptoms
1. To spread awarness about this disease
2. To create more funding so that a cure can be developed.
3. To ask people under 30 years of age to go do their annual checkup regularly!
